Usage notes
Etymology 4
Usage notes
subSections.text:
Only used in compounds. Attaches to [[noun]]s and other [[nominal]]s, often (but not always) with the now-obsolete possessive particle {{m|ja|ã¤|tr=tsu}}.

subSections.title: Etymology 5
Usage notes
subSections.text: Listed in dictionaries<ref name="KDJ"/><ref name="DJR"/><ref name="DJS">{{R:Daijisen}}</ref> as a {{m|ja|å½¢å®¹å‹•è©|tr=keiyÅ dÅshi||''-na'' adjective}}. However, actual usage suggests that this was only used with particle {{m|ja|ã«|tr=ni}} as an [[adverb]], and never with particle {{m|ja|ãª|tr=na}} or classical {{m|ja|ãªã‚‹|tr=naru}} as an [[adjective]]. When this appears [[attributively]], it is followed by particle {{m|ja|ã®|tr=no}},<ref name="SMK5"/> the usual construction when using a noun to modify another noun.

subSections.title: Etymology 6
Usage notes
subSections.text: Listed in some dictionaries<ref name="KDJ"/><ref name="DJR"/><ref name="DJS"/> as a {{m|ja|å½¢å®¹å‹•è©|tr=keiyÅ dÅshi||''-na'' adjective}}; other sources<ref name="SMK5"/> only list this as a {{m|ja|å‰¯è©|tr=fukushi||adverb}}. Historical usage suggests that this was only used with particle {{m|ja|ã«|tr=ni}} as an [[adverb]], and not with particle {{m|ja|ãª|tr=na}} or classical {{m|ja|ãªã‚‹|tr=naru}} as an [[adjective]]. When this appears [[attributively]], it is followed by particle {{m|ja|ã®|tr=no}},<ref name="DJR"/><ref name="DJS"/><ref name="SMK5"/> the usual construction when using a noun to modify another noun.
